panels.title: Important Information

options.content:
This dashboard requires Workload/QOS counter templates.
More information about [ONTAP Performance Guide](https://kb.netapp.com/Advice_and_Troubleshooting/Data_Storage_Software/ONTAP_OS/ONTAP_9_Performance_-_Resolution_Guide) and [Details in ONTAP Performance KB article](https://kb.netapp.com/on-prem/ontap/Perf/Perf-KBs/What_is_the_difference_in_latency_of_the_same_volume_between_statistics_volume_show_and_qos_statistics_volume_latency_show_commands).

panels.title: Highlights

panels.description: This is the rate of this workload's read operations that completed during the measurement interval.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Read IOPS

panels.description: This is the workload's write operations that completed during the measurement interval; measured per second.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Write IOPS

panels.description: This is the workload's other operations that completed during the measurement interval measured per second.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Other IOPS

panels.description: Workload operations executed per second.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Total IOPS

panels.description: This is the amount of data read per second from the filer by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Read Throughput

panels.description: This is the amount of data written per second to the filer by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Write Throughput

panels.description: This is the average response time for read requests that were initiated by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Average Read Latency

panels.description: This is the average response time for write requests that were initiated by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Average Write Latency

panels.description: This is the average response time for requests that were initiated by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Average Latency

panels.description: This is the average number of concurrent requests for the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Concurrency

panels.description: This is the percentage of reads, performed on behalf of the workload, that were sequential.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Sequential Reads (%)

panels.description: This is the percentage of writes, performed on behalf of the workload, that were sequential.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Sequential Writes (%)

panels.description:
This panel represents the proportion of the allocated Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) that is currently being used in a policy, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current IOPs usage by the total available IOPs, and then multiplying the result by 100.

**Important Note:** This panel only covers policies that are shared across workloads.

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
    sum by (cluster, datacenter, policy_group) (
        (
            qos_ops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload!~".*__[0-9]{4}-.*"} * 100
          / on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left ()
            label_replace(
              qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_iops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"},
              "policy_group",
              "$1",
              "name",
              "(.*)"
            )
        )
      * on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left (capacity_shared)
        label_replace(
          qos_policy_fixed_labels{capacity_shared="true",cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",max_throughput_iops!=""},
          "policy_group",
          "$1",
          "name",
          "(.*)"
        )
    ),
    100
  )
and
  topk(
    $TopResources,
    sum by (cluster, datacenter, policy_group) (
      (
          avg_over_time(
            qos_ops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload!~".*__[0-9]{4}-.*"}[3h] @ end()
          )
        / on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left ()
          avg_over_time(
            (
                label_replace(
                  qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_iops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"},
                  "policy_group",
                  "$1",
                  "name",
                  "(.*)"
                )
              * on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left (capacity_shared)
                label_replace(
                  qos_policy_fixed_labels{capacity_shared="true",cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",max_throughput_iops!=""},
                  "policy_group",
                  "$1",
                  "name",
                  "(.*)"
                )
            )[3h:] @ end()
          )
      )
    )
  )

panels.title: Top $TopResources Fixed QoS Shared Policy IOPs Utilization (%)

panels.description:
This panel represents the proportion of the allocated bandwidth that is currently being used in a policy, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current bandwidth usage (in MB/s) by the total available bandwidth (also in MB/s), and then multiplying the result by 100.

**Important Note:** This panel specifically covers policies that are shared across workloads.

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
    sum by (cluster, datacenter, policy_group) (
        (
              qos_total_data{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload!~".*__[0-9]{4}-.*"} * 100
            /
              (1000 * 1000)
          / on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left ()
            label_replace(
              qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_mbps{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"},
              "policy_group",
              "$1",
              "name",
              "(.*)"
            )
        )
      * on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left (capacity_shared)
        label_replace(
          qos_policy_fixed_labels{capacity_shared="true",cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",max_throughput_mbps!=""},
          "policy_group",
          "$1",
          "name",
          "(.*)"
        )
    ),
    100
  )
and
  topk(
    $TopResources,
    sum by (cluster, datacenter, policy_group) (
      (
          avg_over_time(
            qos_total_data{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload!~".*__[0-9]{4}-.*"}[3h] @ end()
          )
        / on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left ()
          avg_over_time(
            (
                label_replace(
                  qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_mbps{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"},
                  "policy_group",
                  "$1",
                  "name",
                  "(.*)"
                )
              * on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left (capacity_shared)
                label_replace(
                  qos_policy_fixed_labels{capacity_shared="true",cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",max_throughput_mbps!=""},
                  "policy_group",
                  "$1",
                  "name",
                  "(.*)"
                )
            )[3h:] @ end()
          )
      )
    )
  )

panels.title: Top $TopResources Fixed QoS Shared Policy Bandwidth Utilization (%)

panels.description:
This panel represents the proportion of the allocated Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) that is currently being used in a policy, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current IOPs usage by the total available IOPs, and then multiplying the result by 100.

**Important Note:** This panel only covers policies that are shared across workloads.

targets.expr:
avg_over_time(
  clamp_max(
    sum by (cluster, datacenter, policy_group, object_count, max_throughput_iops, max_throughput_mbps, min_throughput_iops, min_throughput_mbps) (
        (
            qos_ops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload!~".*__[0-9]{4}-.*"} * 100
          / on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left ()
            label_replace(
              qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_iops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"},
              "policy_group",
              "$1",
              "name",
              "(.*)"
            )
        )
      * on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left (capacity_shared, object_count, max_throughput_iops, max_throughput_mbps, min_throughput_iops, min_throughput_mbps)
        label_replace(
          qos_policy_fixed_labels{capacity_shared="true",cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",max_throughput_iops!=""},
          "policy_group",
          "$1",
          "name",
          "(.*)"
        )
    ),
    100
  )[3h:]
)

panels.title: Fixed QoS Shared Policy IOPs Utilization (%)

The percentage is calculated by dividing the current bandwidth usage (in MB/s) by the total available bandwidth (also in MB/s), and then multiplying the result by 100.

              "policy_group",

        )
      * on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left (capacity_shared, object_count, max_throughput_iops, max_throughput_mbps, min_throughput_iops, min_throughput_mbps)
        label_replace(
          qos_policy_fixed_labels{capacity_shared="true",cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",max_throughput_mbps!=""},

panels.title: Fixed QoS Shared Policy Bandwidth Utilization (%)
Fixed QoS Shared Policy Utilization

panels.description: This panel represents the proportion of the allocated Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) that is currently being used by Workload, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current IOPs usage by the total available IOPs, and then multiplying the result by 100.

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
    (
        (
            qos_ops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload=~"$Workload"}
          / on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left ()
            label_replace(
              qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_iops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"},
              "policy_group",
              "$1",
              "name",
              "(.*)"
            )
        )
      *
        100
    ),
    100
  )
and
  topk(
    $TopResources,
    (
        avg_over_time(
          qos_ops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload=~"$Workload"}[3h] @ end()
        )
      / on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left ()
        avg_over_time(
          label_replace(
            qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_iops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"},
            "policy_group",
            "$1",
            "name",
            "(.*)"
          )[3h:] @ end()
        )
    )
  )

panels.title: Top $TopResources Fixed QoS Workload IOPs Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel represents the proportion of the allocated bandwidth that is currently being used by Workload, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current bandwidth usage (in MB/s) by the total available bandwidth (also in MB/s), and then multiplying the result by 100.

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
    (
      (
          (
              qos_total_data{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload=~"$Workload"} * 100
            /
              (1000 * 1000)
          )
        / on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left ()
          label_replace(
            qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_mbps{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"},
            "policy_group",
            "$1",
            "name",
            "(.*)"
          )
      )
    ),
    100
  )
and
  topk(
    $TopResources,
    (
        avg_over_time(
          qos_total_data{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload=~"$Workload"}[3h] @ end()
        )
      / on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left ()
        avg_over_time(
          label_replace(
            qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_mbps{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"},
            "policy_group",
            "$1",
            "name",
            "(.*)"
          )[3h:] @ end()
        )
    )
  )

panels.title: Top $TopResources Fixed QoS Workload Bandwidth Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel represents the proportion of the allocated Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) that is currently being used by Workload, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current IOPs usage by the total available IOPs, and then multiplying the result by 100.

targets.expr:
avg_over_time(qos_ops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload=~"$Workload"}[3h])
* on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left (max_throughput_iops, max_throughput_mbps, min_throughput_iops, min_throughput_mbps, capacity_shared)
  label_replace(
    qos_policy_fixed_labels{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",max_throughput_iops!=""},
    "policy_group",
    "$1",
    "name",
    "(.*)"
  )

panels.title: Fixed QoS Workload IOPs Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel represents the proportion of the allocated bandwidth that is currently being used by Workload, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current bandwidth usage (in MB/s) by the total available bandwidth (also in MB/s), and then multiplying the result by 100.

targets.expr:
avg_over_time(
    qos_total_data{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload=~"$Workload"}[3h]
  )
* on (datacenter, cluster, policy_group) group_left (max_throughput_iops, max_throughput_mbps, min_throughput_iops, min_throughput_mbps, capacity_shared)
  label_replace(
    qos_policy_fixed_labels{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",max_throughput_mbps!=""},
    "policy_group",
    "$1",
    "name",
    "(.*)"
  )

panels.title: Fixed QoS Workload Bandwidth Utilization (%)
Fixed QoS Workload Utilization

panels.description: This panel displays the percentage of Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) currently in use relative to the dynamically adjusted IOPs threshold, which is set by an adaptive QoS policy. Unlike fixed QoS settings, adaptive QoS policies allow the IOPs threshold to fluctuate based on predefined criteria and workload demands. The utilization percentage is determined by taking the current IOPs usage, dividing it by the adaptive IOPs threshold at that moment, and then multiplying by 100 to get a percentage.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Adaptive QoS Workload IOPs Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel displays the current usage of throughput as a percentage of the adaptive threshold set by an adaptive Quality of Service (QoS) policy. This metric is calculated by dividing the current throughput usage by the adaptive threshold and multiplying by 100. The panel shows data only if the block size is not set to `any`.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Adaptive QoS Workload Bandwidth Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel displays the percentage of Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) currently in use relative to the dynamically adjusted IOPs threshold, which is set by an adaptive QoS policy. Unlike fixed QoS settings, adaptive QoS policies allow the IOPs threshold to fluctuate based on predefined criteria and workload demands. The utilization percentage is determined by taking the current IOPs usage, dividing it by the adaptive IOPs threshold at that moment, and then multiplying by 100 to get a percentage.

targets.expr:
avg_over_time(
  label_join(
    clamp_max(
      (
          (qos_ops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload=~"$Workload"} * 100)
        / on (datacenter, cluster, workload, policy_group, volume, lun, svm, qtree, file, wid)
          qos_workload_max_throughput_iops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",is_adaptive="Yes",workload=~"$Workload"}
      ),
      100
    ),
    "unique_id",
    "-",
    "datacenter",
    "cluster",
    "workload"
  )[3h:]
)

label_join(
    (
        qos_workload_min_throughput_iops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",is_adaptive="Yes",workload=~"$Workload"}
      *
        0
    )
  + on (workload) group_right ()
    (
            1024 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024
          *
            qos_workload_max_throughput_iops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",is_adaptive="Yes",workload=~"$Workload"}
        / on (policy_group, svm) group_left ()
          label_replace(
            qos_policy_adaptive_peak_iops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"},
            "policy_group",
            "$1",
            "name",
            "(.*)"
          )
      unless on (policy_group, svm)
        (
              qos_workload_min_throughput_iops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",is_adaptive="Yes",workload=~"$Workload"}
            - on (policy_group, svm)
              label_replace(
                qos_policy_adaptive_absolute_min_iops{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"},
                "policy_group",
                "$1",
                "name",
                "(.*)"
              )
          ==
            0
        )
    ),
  "unique_id",
  "-",
  "datacenter",
  "cluster",
  "workload"
)

panels.title: Adaptive QoS Workload IOPs Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel displays the current usage of throughput as a percentage of the adaptive threshold set by an adaptive Quality of Service (QoS) policy. This metric is calculated by dividing the current throughput usage by the adaptive threshold and multiplying by 100. The panel shows data only if the block size is not set to `any`.

targets.expr:
avg_over_time(
  label_join(
    clamp_max(
      (
          (
              (qos_total_data{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",workload=~"$Workload"} * 100)
            /
              (1000 * 1000)
          )
        / on (datacenter, cluster, workload, policy_group, volume, lun, svm, qtree, file, wid)
          qos_workload_max_throughput_mbps{cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",is_adaptive="Yes",workload=~"$Workload"}
      ),
      100
    ),
    "unique_id",
    "-",
    "datacenter",
    "cluster",
    "workload"
  )[3h:]
)
